DOC.brief_summary: This study aim determine whether cranberry concentrate reduces recurrent urinary tract infection ( UTIs ) woman . Approximately 150 adult woman recruit participate study . Subjects randomize either cranberry supplement placebo treatment 12 month . Subjects investigator blind supplement taking .
DOC.detailed_description: Participants randomize receive either cranberry concentrate placebo . Participants , study staff investigator remain blinded dataset clean . At baseline visit participant instruct consume assign supplement twice daily 12 consecutive month . A calendar provide record compliance , recurrent UTIs side effect . Participants phoned/texted month encourage participation . Additional study visit complete 3 month , 6 month 9 month collect information recurrent UTIs adherence . A urine sample collect participant visit test pregnancy presence undetected UTI . Supplements distribute visit follow 3-month study period last bottle unused product return . At 12-month visit , participant complete end-line questionnaire return supplement bottle addition calendar side effect diary . If participant withdraw study , encourage return 12 month complete survey allow intent-to-treat analysis .
DOC.criteria: Females least 2 clinicaldiagnosed symptomatic UTIs year precede Can communicate English Current UTI Pregnant breastfeed plan pregnancy next 12 month know allergy intolerance cranberrycontaining product A history renal stone and/or renal transplantation Any immunosuppressive disease medical condition could potentially interfere outcomes Current use corticosteroid , anticoagulant , antidepressant mood stabilize medication medication may interact supplement Intermittent indwell catheterization Any anatomic abnormality urinary tract The use antibiotic within 2 week study entry The use natural health product , include herb , homeopathic product , form cranberry supplement within 2 week study entry
